intro: Moricandia arvensis subsp. alyssifolia, commonly known as field glory, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows in disturbed soils and along roadsides, exhibiting a low-growing, sprawling habit. The plant features small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, with hairy stems and leaves that are lobed or toothed. Its leaves are often mistaken for those of the common chickweed due to their similar appearance. Moricandia arvensis subsp. alyssifolia is known for its adaptability to various soil types and its ability to thrive in sunny to partially shaded conditions.
